column4: I have dual boot with Xp and Lucid, when i am on Lucid my HD starts sounding like a whiny
It may be that your HD is doing some indexing or so. That should be gone after 1-2 minutes. That could be one explanation.
it sounds like running faster
should i do correct it and how
Did you use that machine a little longer now? Do you still think it's running 'faster' after 10 minutes of use?
something is not right with the HD, but it runs smooth, with no sound on XP
when i am on Lucid it makes sound as " OOOOOOOOO'...or maybe the fan runs faster
i have used it for short period like 10 min and 10 hrs too , but it makes the sound
fan may be an issue. GPU may use more power, specially on ATI I guess.
its not ATI  but nvidia
how can i control the sound of the fan/HD?
Do you use the nvidia-property driver? You may have a possibility to undervolt the GPU. YOu could also try to undertvolt CPU.
no properietey driver
Try to install these once. That may help.
how?
Try >system >administration >Additional drivers. The software will tell you, if there is a driver for your GPU.
there is no . additional Driver listed
Ok. Is that a rather old nvidia card?
yes its a old card with came with Dell dimension
still... I am surprised.
still its making sound
linuxpusher_ bye for now
cu
